materials.raw_text: C8 (C8H18): 200 g, Er (Erbium Oxide): 50 g, Tc (Technetium): 5 g, Tm (Thulium Oxide): 10 g, Binder (Polyvinyl Alcohol): 40 g, Water: 100 g.

sourcing.instructions: C8 can be obtained from chemical supply companies or online retailers specializing in hydrocarbons. Erbium Oxide can be sourced from chemical suppliers or materials science vendors. Technetium is typically available through specialized nuclear material suppliers (ensure compliance with regulations). Thulium Oxide can be found at rare earth material suppliers. Polyvinyl Alcohol can be purchased at craft stores or online. Water is available from any tap or bottled source.
steps: C8 can be obtained from chemical supply companies or online retailers specializing in hydrocarbons. Erbium Oxide can be sourced from chemical suppliers or materials science vendors. Technetium is typically available through specialized nuclear material suppliers (ensure compliance with regulations). Thulium Oxide can be found at rare earth material suppliers. Polyvinyl Alcohol can be purchased at craft stores or online. Water is available from any tap or bottled source.
1. Measure 200 g of C8 and place it in a mixing container.
2. Add 50 g of Erbium Oxide to the C8.
3. Introduce 5 g of Technetium into the mixture.
5. In a separate bowl, dissolve 40 g of Polyvinyl Alcohol in 100 g of water until fully mixed.
6. Gradually pour the Polyvinyl Alcohol solution into the solid mixture while stirring continuously to ensure uniform distribution.
preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure 200 g of C8 and place it in a mixing container. 
 2. Add 50 g of Erbium Oxide to the C8. 
 3. Introduce 5 g of Technetium into the mixture. 
 4. Add 10 g of Thulium Oxide. 
 5. In a separate bowl, dissolve 40 g of Polyvinyl Alcohol in 100 g of water until fully mixed. 
 6. Gradually pour the Polyvinyl Alcohol solution into the solid mixture while stirring continuously to ensure uniform distribution.

steps: Heat the combined mixture to 120째C using a hot plate, stirring continuously for 30 minutes until the mixture becomes homogeneous.
heating.raw_text: Heat the combined mixture to 120째C using a hot plate, stirring continuously for 30 minutes until the mixture becomes homogeneous.

steps: Remove the mixture from heat and allow it to cool to room temperature (approximately 25째C) for 1 hour in a well-ventilated area.
cooling.raw_text: Remove the mixture from heat and allow it to cool to room temperature (approximately 25째C) for 1 hour in a well-ventilated area.

steps: Pour the cooled mixture into a mold with dimensions 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. Allow it to set for 24 hours at room temperature. After curing, carefully demold the solid sample. If needed, sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. Optionally, seal the surface with a clear epoxy resin for added durability.
post_processing.raw_text: Pour the cooled mixture into a mold with dimensions 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. Allow it to set for 24 hours at room temperature. After curing, carefully demold the solid sample. If needed, sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. Optionally, seal the surface with a clear epoxy resin for added durability.
